trans-unit.source: Represents XML metadata or references to XML metadata.

The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSection> class conforms to the definition of the `wsx:Metadata/wsx:MetadataSection` element in the WS-Metadata Exchange specification and contains XML metadata or references to XML metadata.
A <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSection> object contains one dialect of metadata in XML form (such as a Web Services Description Language or WSDL file).
You can add a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSection> to a collection of XML metadata represented by a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSet> object.

Much of the [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/includes/indigo1-md.md)] metadata system, such as the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExchangeClient> class, use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSet> class to import or export service metadata in XML form.

For example, to export [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] contract or endpoint objects to a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSet> object that contains the equivalent metadata in XML form, call the appropriate Export methods on the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter> class, passing either <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint> objects, and then call the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter.GetGeneratedMetadata%2A> method.

To import XML-based metadata from a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSet> object into [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)]<xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription>, <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint>, and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Binding> objects, pass a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSet> object to the constructor of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlImporter> class and call one of the import methods.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSection"></xref> class with no dialect, identifier, or XML metadata.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSection"></xref> class using the specified dialect, identifier, and XML metadata.

Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSection.%23ctor%2A> constructor to specify the metadata to be included in this <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSection>, its dialect and its identifier.
The metadata object must be serializable using the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer> class so that the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSection> object can be serialized.
If it is not serializable, an exception is thrown when the object is serialized.

Use a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataLocation> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataReference> object for the `metadata` parameter if you want to include a reference to the metadata instead of the metadata itself.
The dialect of the metadata.
An identifier for the metadata.
The XML metadata.
Gets a collection of XML attributes that you can use to add or remove attributes extensions to the metadata.
Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSection.Attributes%2A> property to add or remove attribute extensions.
The dialect and identifier attributes are not included in this collection.
The collection of XML attributes for the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSection"></xref>.
The default collection is empty.
Creates a <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSection"></xref> from the specified policy information.
Use <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSection.CreateFromPolicy%2A> method to create a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSection> for a WS-Policy policy expression.

The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSection.Dialect%2A> property is set to <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSection.PolicyDialect%2A> and the `identifier` is assigned to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSection.Identifier%2A> property.
The recommend identifier is the `wsp:Name` attribute for the policy expression.
An XML representation of a policy as defined in WS-Policy.
An identifier for the policy.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSection"></xref> that contains the specified policy expression with the specified identifier.
The XML element is not a policy element.
The policy is `null`.
Creates a <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSection"></xref> from the specified <xref href="System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchema"></xref> object.
Use this static factory method to quickly create a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSection> for a XML Schema document.

The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSection.Dialect%2A> property is assigned the value of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSection.XmlSchemaDialect%2A> and the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSection.Identifier%2A> property is assigned the value of the target namespace of the XML Schema document.
An XML Schema document.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSection"></xref> containing the specified XML schema.
The schema is `null`.
Returns a <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSection"></xref> that contains the specified <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescription"></xref>.
Use this static factory method to quickly create a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSection> for a WSDL document.

The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSection.Dialect%2A> property is assigned the value of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSection.ServiceDescriptionDialect%2A> and the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSection.Identifier%2A> property is assigned the value of the target namespace of the WSDL document.
The <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescription"></xref> used to create a <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSection"></xref> object.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSection"></xref> that contains the specified <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescription"></xref>.
The serviceDescription is `null`.
Gets or sets a value that indicates the type of metadata.
The dialect indicates the type of metadata in this <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSection>.
The dialect strings with supported object models are:
The dialect for the metadata.
The default is `null`.
Gets or sets an identifier for the metadata.
The identifier for the metadata in this <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSection>.
The value depends on the type of metadata.
The identifier for the metadata.
The default is `null`.
Gets or sets the contained metadata object.
Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSection.Metadata%2A> property to access or modify the metadata content contained in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSection>.
The metadata object can be <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataReference> or a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataLocation> as a reference to the metadata content.
When a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSection> is deserialized, the type of the metadata object is determined from the XML content.
The following table describes the possible return values.
Type of XML metadata
Returned type
WSDL document
XML Schema
Metadata reference
Metadata location
Policy, and all other XML content
The metadata contents for this <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSection"></xref>.
Contains the value of the metadata exchange dialect.
The dialect for a WS-Metadata Exchange document.
The dialect for a WS-Metadata Exchange document.
Contains the value of the WS-Policy dialect.
The dialect for a WS-Policy policy expression.
The dialect for a WS-Policy policy expression.
Contains the value of the Web Services Description Language (WSDL) dialect.
The dialect.
The dialect for a WSDL document.
Contains the value of the XML Schema dialect.
The dialect for an XML Schema document.
The dialect for an XML Schema document.
